taskbody.context: Use this procedure to start the service.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .

step.info: To monitor progress, enter the following command: journalctl -flu serviced -o cat

stepresult.p: On hosts with internet access, the serviced daemon invokes docker to pull its internal services images from Docker Hub. The browser and command-line interfaces are unavailable until the images are installed and tagged, and the services are started. The process takes about 5 minutes.
On hosts without internet access, the serviced daemon tags images in the registry and starts its internal services. The browser and command-line interfaces are unavailable for about 3 minutes.
When the message Host Master successfully started is displayed, is ready for the next steps.

step.cmd: Add the master host to the default resource pool.

info.note: Perform this step only if you are installing a single-host deployment.

stepxmp.p: Replace Hostname-Or-IP with the hostname or IP address of the master host:
If you enter a hostname, all hosts in your cluster must be able to resolve the name, either through an entry in /etc/hosts, or through a nameserver on your network.
